result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth H Stencel

records.addlTxt: Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner (sent to Br 1 Judge on 11/02/22 sp)
Competency hearing on January 10, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

1:49 PM Defendant Kenneth H Stencel in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Kenneth H Stencel.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Matter is set for an initial appearance.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Issue of competency is raised.

17CF-152 Waushara County Case is referred to.
Court reviews this case referenced.

State has no objection/nothing to add.

BY THE COURT
Court will order competency evaluation.
Atty Bergner to prepare order and schedule hearing with Judicial Assistant.

Bond is continued.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Bergner.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 10/31/22 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal controlled substances. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business.
Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License.

1:28 PM Defendant Kenneth Harry Stencel appeared by video, in custody.  
Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 5th. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is  eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 
State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant objects and requests a lower cash bond and states reasons on the record.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
